docs.title: Design Document - Part II API
docs.description: What should be in this section.

frontMatter.description: What should be in this section.

docs.title: Speech to Text Feature
docs.description: The Speech to Text feature provides real-time speech recognition capabilities, converting spoken words into text. This is particularly useful for accessibility and hands-free text input in the AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication) system.

docs.title: Acceptance test
docs.description: Demonstration of all of the functional and non-functional requirements. This can be a combination of automated tests derived from the use-cases (user stories) and manual tests with recorded observation of the results.

docs.title: Integration tests
docs.description: Tests to demonstrate each use-case based on the use-case descriptions and the sequence diagrams. External input should be provided via mock objects and results verified via mock objects. Integration tests should not require manual entry of data nor require manual interpretation of results.

docs.title: Unit tests
docs.description: For each method, one or more test cases.

link.description: Please remove and replace examples where necessary.
Please remove and replace examples where necessary.

docs.title: Figure Component
docs.description: The figure component is used for images or media that should be referenced.

docs.title: Getting Started with Your Documentation Site
docs.description: Welcome! This guide will help you get started with the documentation template, whether you're seeing this for the first time or already have it running.

docs.title: Congratulations!
docs.description: You have just learned the basics of Docusaurus and made some changes to the initial template.

docs.title: Create a Document
docs.description: Documents are groups of pages connected through:

docs.title: Create a Page
docs.description: Add Markdown or React files to src/pages to create a standalone page:

docs.title: Deploy your site
docs.description: This template includes automatic deployment to GitHub Pages using GitHub Actions. Every time you push changes to the main branch, your site is automatically built and deployed!

docs.title: Markdown Features
docs.description: Docusaurus supports Markdown and a few additional features.

docs.title: Mermaid Diagrams (UML)
docs.description: Using Mermaid to create diagrams and visualizations directly in Docusaurus offers significant advantages over static images. With Mermaid, your diagrams are written as code, making them easy to version control, review, and update alongside your documentation. This approach ensures your diagrams always stay in sync with your project, reduces maintenance overhead, and eliminates the hassle of regenerating and uploading new images for every change. As your project evolves, updating a diagram is as simple as editing a few lines of text, making your documentation more agile, consistent, and future-proof.

docs.title: Set Environment Variables
docs.description: This guide explains how to set the PROJECTNAME and ORGNAME environment variables needed for the contributors section to work properly.

docs.title: Manage Docs Versions
docs.description: Docusaurus can manage multiple versions of your docs.

link.description: 5 minutes to learn the most important Docusaurus concepts.
Custom Components built for the CIS 4398.

default.title: Markdown page example
default.description: You don't need React to write simple standalone pages.

info.title: Swagger Petstore - OpenAPI 3.0
info.description:
This is a sample Pet Store Server based on the OpenAPI 3.0 specification.  You can find out more about
Swagger at [http://swagger.io](http://swagger.io). In the third iteration of the pet store, we've switched to the design first approach!
You can now help us improve the API whether it's by making changes to the definition itself or to the code.
That way, with time, we can improve the API in general, and expose some of the new features in OAS3.

Some useful links:
- [The Pet Store repository](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-petstore)
- [The source API definition for the Pet Store](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-petstore/blob/master/src/main/resources/openapi.yaml)

externalDocs.description: Find out more about our store

put.description: Update an existing pet by Id

requestBody.description: Update an existent pet in the store

post.summary: Add a new pet to the store
post.description: Add a new pet to the store

requestBody.description: Create a new pet in the store

get.description: Multiple status values can be provided with comma separated strings

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status values that need to be considered for filter

get.description: Multiple tags can be provided with comma separated strings. Use tag1, tag2, tag3 for testing.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Tags to filter by

parameters.name: petId
parameters.description: ID of pet to return

post.summary: Updates a pet in the store with form data

parameters.name: petId
parameters.description: ID of pet that needs to be updated

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of pet that needs to be updated

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of pet that needs to be updated

parameters.name: petId
parameters.description: Pet id to delete

parameters.name: petId
parameters.description: ID of pet to update

parameters.name: additionalMetadata
parameters.description: Additional Metadata

get.description: Returns a map of status codes to quantities

post.summary: Place an order for a pet
post.description: Place a new order in the store

get.description: For valid response try integer IDs with value <= 5 or > 10. Other values will generate exceptions.

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: ID of order that needs to be fetched

delete.description: For valid response try integer IDs with value < 1000. Anything above 1000 or nonintegers will generate API errors

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: ID of the order that needs to be deleted

post.description: This can only be done by the logged in user.

post.summary: Creates list of users with given input array
post.description: Creates list of users with given input array

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The user name for login

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password for login in clear text

X-Rate-Limit.description: calls per hour allowed by the user

X-Expires-After.description: date in UTC when token expires

get.summary: Logs out current logged in user session

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name that needs to be fetched. Use user1 for testing.

put.description: This can only be done by the logged in user.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: name that need to be deleted

requestBody.description: Update an existent user in the store

delete.description: This can only be done by the logged in user.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name that needs to be deleted

Pet.description: Pet object that needs to be added to the store
